knimeNode.name: Pivoting
knimeNode.shortDescription: Node computes an aggregation value between all co-occurrences of two column, pivot and group column. The aggregation can be based on a third numeric column, or just the number of occurrences.

fullDescription.intro: The node counts the co-occurrences of all value pairs between the group and pivot column. If an aggregation column is selected, the value between the co-occurrences is computed based on the selected aggregation method. In the resulting pivot table, the possible values of the group column appear as row IDs and the values of the pivot column as column names. The value in each cell of the table is the aggregation value, either the number of occurrences or the computed aggregation value.
fullDescription.option: Select a column to find all co-occurrences among the values of the group column. The values of this column define the column header.
Select a column to perform a grouping on. The column values are then used as row IDs.
If selected, the aggregation is performed based on one selected numeric column to which the selected aggregation method is applied.
Select a numeric column used to aggregate all occurrences of the pivot values within one group.

If no aggregation column has been selected, simply the numbers of co-occurrences are counted between the group and pivot column. The following methods can be applied to the aggregation column: SUM, MEAN, MIN, MAX, VARIANCE, and STD DEVIATION.
Select, if hiliting is enabled between input and output data.
Ignore rows containing missing values in pivot column.

ports.inPort: Input table with at least two columns used to group against the pivot column. In addition, an aggregation column can be applied.
ports.outPort: Pivoting table with aggregated values of co-occurrences between pivot and group column.
